New Records: Pete Alonso became the first major leaguer to hit a go-ahead homer when his team was trailing in the ninth inning or later of a winner-take-all postseason game.
Milwaukee Brewers set a franchise record for postseason appearances (sixth) in seven years.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a go-ahead, three-run homer off Devin Williams in the ninth inning to spark a 9th-inning rally.
Milwaukee Brewers had a two-hit shutout through the first eight innings but were unable to maintain their lead in the ninth.
Pre-Game Insights: The New York Mets were underdogs heading into the game but showed resilience after falling behind early.
Manager Pat Murphy emphasized the team's love and the difficulty of the loss.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Pat Murphy expressed pride in the team's effort but acknowledged the loss as tragic.
Pete Alonso's homer marked a pivotal moment in the Mets' playoff journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first postseason meeting between the Mets and the Brewers.
The Mets' win marked their first playoff series victory since 2015.
Others: The game was played at American Family Field with a crowd of 41,594 fans.
